name: Laura's husband: Almanzo James Wilder Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
February 13, 1857.

	Almanzo James Wilder was born on February 13, 1857 near Malone, NY.  He was the 5th of six children.

questions.text: How many siblings did Almanzo have?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Their names are (from oldest to youngest): Laura, Royal, Eliza Jane, Alice, Almanzo (himself), and Perley.  Laura was not included in "Farmer Boy" because Laura thought it would cause too much confusion.  Perley was not born at the time "Farmer Boy" took place.

James and Angeline Day Wilder.

	Charles and Caroline Ingalls was Laura's parents.  Rose was Almanzo and Laura's daughter.  Perley and Alice were Almanzo's brother and sister.

questions.text: What was Almanzo's favorite dish when he was a boy?
questions.explanation:
apples and onions.

	Almanzo would eat three to four large helpings of apples and onions when his mother would make them.

questions.text: When were Laura and Almanzo married?
questions.explanation:
August 25, 1885.

	Laura and Almanzo were married on August 25, 1885 at the home of the Rev. Brown in DeSmet, Dakota Territory.  Rose was born on December 5, 1886.

questions.text: What was Laura's nickname for Almanzo?
questions.explanation:
Manly.

	Laura called him Manly.  He called her Bessie or Beth.  Moony was Loretta Lynn's husband's nickname.

questions.text: How long did it take Almanzo to complete their house on Rocky Ridge Farm?
questions.explanation:
15 years.

	Almanzo built their home mostly from materials on the land.  Rocky Ridge Farm grew to over 200 acres.

questions.text: Almanzo once drove 40 miles in blizzard conditions to get wheat to keep the town of DeSmet from starving?
questions.explanation:
True.

	During the "hard winter" of 1880-81 there had been so many blizzards that the trains stopped running until spring.  There was no way of getting supplies into DeSmet.  When the town ran completely out of supplies, to keep from selling his seed wheat, Almanzo and Cap Garland drove out into the prairie looking for a farmer that was rumored to have wheat.  They drove 40 miles round trip looking for him.  Fortunately, the trip was a success and he a Cap both returned safely.

questions.text: What caused Almanzo to have a limp?
questions.explanation:
stroke.

	Almanzo and Laura caught diptheria in 1888.  Almanzo went back to work too soon which caused a relapse.  The relapse caused a stroke which lead to partial paralysis.  He recovered from the paralysis, but it left his feet crippled.

October 23, 1949.

	Almanzo passed away on October 23, 1949 at the age of 92 from heart failure.  He and Laura had been married 64 years.
